reference_summary:
Sid the Science Kid: Sid in Motion Sid the Science Kid (Actor), Katy Garretson (Director), David Gumpel (Director) & 0 more Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Kids & Family ["Sid the Science Kid ™ is trying out his new dance, Sid Slide to the Side, on his hardwood floors when he discovers that friction prevents him from sliding in his sneakers. When he plays ball, he quickly learns that if a ball doesn't have enough elasticity, it won't bounce! This calls for some serious investigating! After pretending to be Super Sid by kicking the ball with all his might, Sid and his friends take a trip to the Science Center to investigate how using lots of force makes things move far and fast! Join Sid and his friends as they explore the laws of motion!"] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8646994', 'Director': 'Katy Garretson, David Gumpel', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Animated, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 minute', 'Release date': 'January 10, 2012', 'Actors': 'Sid the Science Kid', 'Studio': 'Ncircle', 'Number of discs': '1'} Sid the science kid is a must for young kids. My grandson starting watching it at age three and has picked up an amazing vocabulary and science concepts. I find it entertaining, too. Quick delivery, reliable seller. One of the best! Sid the Science Kid: Sense-Ational Adventures Sid and Friends (Actor), The Jim Henson Company (Director) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Kids & Family ["Did you hear that? Can you see this? What's that smell? Sid and his friends are embarking on a quest to explore vision, hearing, touch, smell and taste! Sid wonders why the tag on his shirt is really itchy so his class explores all the different textures around them. Sid is curious about why Grandma's glasses help her see clearly, but make things blurry for him. But when it comes to hearing, is it possible that Sid has super powers? Find out all about Sid's Super Duper Senses and find out about your own senses in these sense-sational stories!"] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '6313446', 'Director': 'The Jim Henson Company', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Animated, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 4, 2011', 'Actors': 'Sid and Friends', 'Studio': 'Ncircle', 'Number of discs': '1'} Sid the science kid is a must for young kids. My grandson starting watching it at age three and has picked up an amazing vocabulary and science concepts. I find it entertaining, too. Quick delivery, reliable seller. Sid is GREAT!!!! Directed by Robert Altman.'] {'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Robert Altman', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, DVD, Subtitled, Widescreen, NTSC', 'Run time': '2 hours and 1 minute', 'Release date': 'June 4, 2002', 'Actors': 'Warren Beatty, Julie Christie, Rene Auberjonois, William Devane, John Schuck', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Japanese', 'Language': 'Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1), French (Dolby Digital 2.0), English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Studio': 'Warner Home Video', 'Writers': 'Edmund Naughton, Robert Altman, Brian McKay', 'Number of discs': '1'} If you are a Beatty and Christy fan, you will enjoy this movie. Worth watching for the scenery and music! One of my favorites Broadway Musicals: A Jewish Legacy Joel Grey (Actor), Michael Kantor (Director) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Documentary ['Recent Peabody Award winner as seen on PBS', "Performances by Matthew Broderick, Kelli O'Hara, Zero Mostel, Nathan Lane, Barbra Streisand, Idina Menzel, Kristin Chenoweth, and many more Engaging, humorous, and provocative,", 'Broadway Musicals: A Jewish Legacy', "examines the unique role of Jewish composers and lyricists in the creation of the modern American musical. The film showcases the work of legends such as Irving Berlin, Jerome Kern, George and Ira Gershwin, Lorenz Hart, Richard Rodgers, Oscar Hammerstein II, Leonard Bernstein, and Stephen Sondheim. Interviews with songwriters and luminaries including Sheldon Harnick, Stephen Schwartz, Harold Prince, Arthur Laurents, Charles Strouse, and Mel Brooks provide insight, alongside standout performances and archival footage. Narrated by Tony® and Academy Award® winner Joel Grey, this entertaining documentary mingles cultural history with illuminating perspectives on the origins and meanings of some of Broadway's most beloved songs, stories, and shows."] {'Genre': 'Special Interests', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Joel Grey, Michael Kantor', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '26355977', 'Director': 'Michael Kantor', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 24 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 7, 2013', 'Actors': 'Joel Grey', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '2'} This has great songs and music and raw footage of the old stars. It was both very informative and enjoyable! profile:
**Updated User Summary:**

- **Target Audience**: The user primarily focuses on children's educational content for preschool-aged kids but has a growing engagement with classic films and Broadway musicals.
- **Content Preference**: Enjoys animated, science-oriented shows that merge entertainment with learning, along with documentaries exploring music and cultural history. Their growing interest in classic cinema is evident, reflecting an appreciation for diverse storytelling methods. Recent feedback indicates a discerning taste, particularly regarding film adaptations of literary classics.
- **Review Behavior**: Consistently leaves constructive reviews that emphasize educational value and entertainment quality. The user expressing a less favorable opinion on a recent adaptation showcases an evolving taste and critical view of classic film interpretations. Still values a reliable purchasing experience and trustworthy sellers.
- **Emotional Connection**: Often references a grandchild's enjoyment in selecting media, indicating a family-oriented approach that prioritizes educational growth and shared enjoyment in films. 
- **Engagement Level**: Actively seeks materials that are both engaging for children and intellectually stimulating. The user appreciates immersive aesthetic and auditory experiences in children's programming and classic films alike while demonstrating a willingness to differentiate between various adaptations of literary works.

Overall, the user continues to prioritize high-quality children’s media that supports learning objectives while refining their appreciation for classic films, showcasing a proactive engagement in enhancing educational growth through varied entertainment.
